intro: Ludwigia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, preferring moist to aquatic environments. It is often used in water gardens and as a decorative plant in ponds due to its attractive foliage and blooms. Ludwigia lanceolata is also valued for its ability to provide habitat for aquatic invertebrates and small fish.
